etymology.description: 泉(泉) (quán, "spring") + 厂(厂) (chǎng, "cliff") = a spring bursting from a cliff-side -> origin
etymology.interpretation: The character 原(yuán) illustrates the concept of an origin by depicting a source of water, a spring 泉(quán), emerging from a cliff 厂(chǎng). This representation of a spring from a cliff metaphorically suggests the beginning or source of water, symbolizing the concept of origin.

examples.chinese: 每个传说都有它的原(每個傳說都有它的原)，我们应回溯历史寻找真相(我們應回溯歷史尋找真相)。
examples.pinyin: měi gè chuánshuō dōu yǒu tā de yuán, wǒmen yīng huísuō lìshǐ xúnzhǎo zhēnxiàng.
examples.english: Every legend has its origin; we should retrace history to seek the truth.

examples.chinese: 古老文化的原(古老文化的原)，蕴藏着智慧之光(蘊藏著智慧之光)。
examples.pinyin: gǔlǎo wénhuà de yuán, yùncáng zhe zhìhuì zhī guāng.
examples.english: The origin of ancient culture conceals the light of wisdom.
